channel.title: Help, AUTOlogoff
channel.description:
Recent, I downloaded a crack for Kasersky 7.0
I ran a Virus Scan and told it to delete everything, and it reboots my comp. When it goes to the login screen, it logs in and automatically logs off. It doesn't even give me enough time to press CTRL + ALT + DELTE
How do I solve this?

item.title: Help, AUTOlogoff
item.dc:creator: @nicatron nicatron
item.description:
@nicatron wrote:

USE a livecd Delete the crack, delete anything in startup, then reboot

Read full topic

item.title: Help, AUTOlogoff
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:7, topic:146990”][quote author=Schizzo link=topic=201021.msg1785824#msg1785824 date=1190975484]
Have you tried selecting the option “Restore to the last known good configuration”? You should see it at the same place you see the safe mode options.
[/quote]

That only affects something if it won’t boot up, since this will boot up and simply logs him out it won’t do anything.

What if you log in as a different user in safe mode? Do you get any errors at all? It almost sounds like a reinstall issue.[/quote]
I doubt it will work, but I should give it a try.

Read full topic

item.title: Help, AUTOlogoff
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Schizzo:

Have you tried selecting the option “Restore to the last known good configuration”? You should see it at the same place you see the safe mode options.

That only affects something if it won’t boot up, since this will boot up and simply logs him out it won’t do anything.

What if you log in as a different user in safe mode? Do you get any errors at all? It almost sounds like a reinstall issue.

Read full topic

item.title: Help, AUTOlogoff
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

Have you tried selecting the option “Restore to the last known good configuration”? You should see it at the same place you see the safe mode options.

Read full topic

item.title: Help, AUTOlogoff
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

System files… Maybe a system recovery?

Read full topic

item.title: Help, AUTOlogoff
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

Well that was my only idea, lol. I thought that maybe Kaspersky was running something on startup that was screwing you up. I guess you deleted something important…

Read full topic

item.title: Help, AUTOlogoff
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

Have you tried booting up in safe mode?

Read full topic
